channel.title: Softlayer_network_media_transcode_job on SoftLayer API
channel.description: Recent content in Softlayer_network_media_transcode_job on SoftLayer API

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job Service Datatype Description SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job holds information on a transcode job. To create a transcode job, use a [[SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Account|Transcode account]] object. Methods createObject Creates a transcode job getHistory getObject Retrieve a SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job record. getTranscodeAccount Retrieve the transcode service account getTranscodeStatus Retrieve the status information of a transcode job getTranscodeStatusName Retrieve the status of a transcode job getUser Retrieve the SoftLayer user that created the transcode job

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job contains information regarding a transcode job such as input file, output format, user id and so on. Local autoDeleteDuration The auto-deletion duration in seconds. This value determines how long the input file will be kept on the storage. Type: integer byteIn The size of an input file in byte Type: integer createDate The created date Type: dateTime

item.title: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job Service Datatype Description The SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job contains information regarding a transcode job such as input file, output format, user id and so on. Local autoDeleteDuration The auto-deletion duration in seconds. This value determines how long the input file will be kept on the storage. Type: integer byteIn The size of an input file in byte Type: integer createDate The created date Type: dateTime

item.title: createObject
item.description: SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job::createObject Overview With this method, you can create a transcode job. The very first step of creating a transcode job is to upload your media files to the /in directory on your Transcode FTP space. Then, you have to pass a [[SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job|Transcode job]] object as a parameter for this method. There are 4 required properties of SoftLayer_Network_Media_Transcode_Job object: transcodePresetName, transcodePresetGuid, inputFile, and outputFile. A transcode preset is a configuration that defines a certain media output.
